desc: Deck of Anki flashcards for learning for the Linux Professional Institute (LPI) LPIC-1 exams 101 and 102. Please report mistakes. Thank you. Website: https://github.com/jonasjacek/lpic-1-anki-flashcards Author: Jonas Jacek
name: LPIC-1

note_models.name: Basic-d3287

fields: What is the suggested minimum space requirement for /home?
There is no minimum space requirement, as this is not predicatable.
What is a 'hard link' in Linux terminology?

A hard link is an additional name for an existing file.

e.g.:
fsck.ext2, fsck.ext3, fsck.ext4, e2fsck - different names for the same program.
Control character (escaped) which represents the backslash?
Option to have rm ignore nonexistent files and arguments and never prompt?

$ rm -f

or

$ rm --force
What kind of information does procfs include?
runtime system information
Option(s) to use with rpm to print detailed information about an uninstalled package file? [2]

$ rpm -qpi <packagename.rpm>

or

$ rpm -qp --info <packagename.rpm>
Where does the boot loader reside?
Master Boot Record (MBR).
How many runlevels are supported by the standard Linux Kernel?
Option to use with chmod to output a diagnostic for every file processed?

$ chmod -v

or

$ chmod --verbose
Basic fdisk command to print a list of all supported filesystems?
l (list)
Location of kernel parameters which can be modified using sysctl?
/proc/sys/
Individual configuration files, which are valid for single users, are stored in?

~

or

/home/user

e.g.:
~/.bashrc
Option to have df report its data in one-megabyte (M) blocks?
$ df -m
Option to use with grep to suppress normal output and instead print a count of matching lines for each input file?

$ grep -c 

or

$ grep --count
Which are 6 (possible) user configuration files which are located in the user's home directory?

1. ~/.bash_profile
2. ~/.bash_login
3. ~/.profile
4. ~/.bashrc
5. ~/.bash_logout
6. ~/.inputrc
Option to use with rpm to install a package even if conflicts exist?
$ rpm -i --force <packagename.rpm>
Option to use with fsck to cause the filesystem-specific fsck to always attempt to fix any detected filesystem corruption automatically?

$ fsck <FILESYSTEM> -y

e.g.:
$ fsck -A -t ext2 -y

Explanation:
The -y option is not understood by fsck, it will be passed to the filesystem-specific checker. Not all filesystem checkers support this option.
Wildcard metacharacter to match the beginning of a word in a regular expression for grep?
\<
Command to examine what I/O ports are being used for various purposes?
$ cat /proc/ioports
Command to print a list of all partitions of all hard drives of a system?
$ cat /proc/partitions
Command to signal SIGCONT (continue executing, if stopped) to a process?
$ bg
Command to change file owner and group?
$ chown
Option to use with find to search for files which were last changed (e.g. file name, permissions, etc.)  n*24 hours ago?
$ find -ctime n
Where are modprobe configuration files located? [2]

- /etc/modprobe.conf
- /etc/modprobe.d (in case of multiple files, in a directory)
Which signature Hex marks the beginning of a partition table of the Master Boot Record (MBR)?

8020

(Marks the beginning of a partition table.)
What is the 4th column of /etc/fstab used for?
The 4th column is used for basic security by designating by whom and how the filesystem/device can be used.
Name two advantages of using LVM over traditional disk managment.

- it's easy to dynamically resize and create new disks and partitions
- which allows to add and remove hardware as needed
Command to print all entries (lines) containing 'Jimmy', 'jimmy', 'Jimmi', 'jimmi' and 'Jonny' in adress.list?

$ grep -i j*[iy] address.list

or

$ grep -i j...[iy] address.list

or

$ grep -i j.[mn].[iy] address.list

...
Which special file type corresponds with the character b?
b = block device files
An AND command list has the form...

$ command1 && command2

Explanation:
command2 is executed only if, command1 returns an exit status of zero (successful, true).
Command to print the first 20 lines of file1.txt and file2.txt?
$ head -n 20 file1.txt file2.txt
What does LBA stand for?
Logical Block Addressing (LBA)
Which bash configuration file does not require a new log in to apply changes?
~/.bashrc
What does the classic form of command substitution use to generate command-line text?

backquotes (backticks) ` ... `

e.g.: 
$ rm `ls *.txt`
Which is the main syntax difference between nice and renice?

Nice requires the nice value to be prefixed with a minus, renice doesn't. For example, to run a process with a nice value of 15:

$ nice -15 PID
$ renice 15 PID

To run a process with a nice value of -15:

$ nice --15 PID
$ renice -15 PID
Command to run a shell builtin?

$ builtin

e.g.:
$ builtin echo 

explanation:
Useful in cases where e.g. an alias with the same name as a builtin exists.
Escape sequence (backslash-escaped special character) for an ASCII bell character?
\a
Command to read files, change their block size and write them (copy & convert)?
$ dd
Command to estimate file space usage?
$ du
To declare a function, are the round brackets/parentheses needed?

No.

e.g.:
function add () { let sum=$1+$2; echo -e 'the sum is: $sum'; }

or

function add { let sum=$1+$2; echo -e 'the sum is: $sum'; }

or

add () { let sum=$1+$2; echo -e 'the sum is: $sum'; }

Explanation:
All 3 functions do the same thing.
Command to check and repair a Linux filesystem?
$ fsck
Command to print a full quota report for /dev/sdb1?
$ repquota -avug /dev/sdb1
May comments follow tabs and whitespace at the beginning of a line?

Yes

e.g.:
    # A tab/whitespaces precede this comment.
What is the naming convention for variables to prevent them from conflicting with environment variables?

To prevent variables from conflicting with environment variables, it is a good practice to use lower case letters.

e.g.:
$variable
Opions to use to compress tar files with bzip2? [2]

$ tar -j

or

$ tar --bzip2
Command to set the delay between screen updates for top to 0.5 seconds?
$ top -d 0.5
What is the name of the operation that expands a wildcard pattern into the list of pathnames matching the pattern?
Globbing
Is it generally possible to convert an ext2 files system to an ext4 filesystem?
Yes! Ext2 and ext3 are designed to be easily upwards compatible.
MySQL command to get a list of databases the current user has access to?
mysql> show databases;
Escape sequence (backslash-escaped special character) for new line?
\n
systemd: Command to reboot the system?
$ systemctl isolate reboot.target
Command to download and install a package with yum?
$ yum install <packagename>
Command to force fsck check after an immediate reboot?
$ shutdown -F -r now
Where does rpm store databases with components, dependencies, confilicts, etc.?
/var/lib/rpm/
Command to check a Linux ReiserFS file system?
$ fsck.reiserfs
How does the GRUB legacy prompt look like?
grub>
Command to print the full path of a command, for example firefox?

$ which firefox

e.g.: 
$ which firefox
/usr/bin/firefox
Vi command to open new.txt and simoultaneously close old.txt (changes should be saved first)?
:e new.txt
What is the Industry Standard Architecture (ISA)?
A data transfer standard
Option to use with depmod to check if any modules are newer than the ones listed in modules.dep file?

$ depmod -A

or 

$ depmod --quick
What is the name of the first process (PID1)?
init
Basic fdisk command to write the new partition table and exit?
w (write)
Option to have sort write results to outfile.txt instead of standard output?
$ sort -o outfile.txt
Name and location of one of the original bash configuration files that is only read on new log in?
~/.profile
If multiple SOURCE files are used with cp, what will the last argument be treated like?

The last argument will be treated as the DEST directory.

e.g.:
$ cp file1 file2 file3 dest
Option to use with modinfo to show possible parameters of a module?

$ modinfo -p

or 

$ modinfo --parameters
According to the Filesystem Hierarchy Standard (FHS), are /home and /root optional directories?
Yes, according to the Filesystem Hierarchy Standard (FHS) they are optional.
Vi command (normal mode) to change (replace) entire line (cut and switch to input mode)?
cc
Location of files and directories that are copied over to a new user's home directory when such user is created by the useradd program.
/etc/skel
Information to add to /etc/fstab in the <filesystem> column for a swap partition at /dev/sdb1?

/dev/sdb1

e.g.:
<filesystem> <mount point>   <type>  <options>       <dump>  <pass>
/dev/sdb1      swap                swap     pri=42            0            0
Command line to run command2 directly after command2?

$ command1;command2

e.g.: 
$ free -m;df -h
Which symbol indicates a symbolic link in symbolic permission notations?

l

e.g.:
lrwxrwxrwx
The organization of the partition table in the MBR limits the maximum addressable storage space of a partition to?
<= 2 TB
What does DML abbreviate?
Data Manipulation Language
What happens if a command is terminated by the control operator &?
The shell executes the command asynchronously in a subordinate shell (in the background) and does not wait for the command to finish. The exit status is 0 (successful, true).
What do the 12 bits for permissions of files and directories contain?

- 1 set user ID bit
- 1 set group ID bit
- 1 sticky bit
- 3 user persmission bits
- 3 group persmission bits
- 3 world persmission bits
Option to use with fsck to use the badblocks program to do a read-only scan of the device in order to find any bad blocks?

$ fsck <FILESYSTEM> -c

The -c option is not understood by fsck, it will be passed to the filesystem-specific checker.
Command to report all current processes as a tree?
$ pstree
Command to reconfigure all installed dpkg packages?
$ dpkg-reconfigure -a
What is the most compact syntax of the if statement?

if <TEST-COMMANDS>; then <CONSEQUENT-COMMANDS>; fi 

Explanation:
The <TEST-COMMAND> list is executed, and if its return status is zero, the <CONSEQUENT-COMMANDS> list is executed.
Command to create a Linux XFS file system?
$ mkfs.xfs
Vi command (normal mode) to yank (copy) a line?
yy
Command to search for firefox with yum?
$ yum search firefox
Which user should own the aquota.user and aquota.group files?
root
Command used to modify kernel parameters at runtime?
$ sysctl
Each case statement clause must be terminated with ...

;;

e.g.:
case <EXPRESSION> in 
  <CASE1>) <COMMAND-LIST>;; 
  <CASE2>) <COMMAND-LIST>;; 
  ...
  <CASEN>) <COMMAND-LIST>;; 
esac
What is the location of modules.dep?
/lib/modules/<kernel-version>/modules.dep
Command to find out which DMA addresses a system uses?
$ cat /proc/dma
Vi command (normal mode) to put (paste) the clipboard before cursor/above current line?
P
Option to have ps print all processes (even by other users) except processes not associated with a terminal?
$ ps -a
To which runlevel(s) does Linux boot by default? [2]

3, 5 

(Runlevel 3 permits the system to run all services except for a GUI. Runlevel 5 allows all services including a GUI.)
What does the 1st column of /etc/fstab list?
The first column lists the physical location of each filesystem/device.
Command to convert tabs to spaces?
$ expand
What does f[a-c]il expand to?

- fail
- fbil
- fcil
Command to lookup rpm database to see if firefox is installed?
$ rpm -q firefox
Option to use with mount to mount all filesystems mentioned in /etc/fstab?

$ mount -a

mount

$ mount --all
Escape sequence (backslash-escaped special character) for the current working directory?
\w
What does PCI mean?
Peripheral Component Interconnect
Can shell custom variables be exported to higher/parent shells?
No. Custom shell variables can only be exported to subshells.
What is the default sort-option for pstree?
pstree shows processes in alphabetical order.
Command to use chown to set the group ownership of /files to root?

$ chown .root /files 

or

$ chown :root /files
Command to translate all newline characters to ; in input.txt and save the result to output.txt?
$ cat intput.txt | tr \\n \; > output.txt
bash is backward compatible to ... ?
sh
Which are the quota file names for users and groups? [2]

1. aquota.user
2. aquota.group
According to the Filesystem Hierarchy Standard (FHS) where can variable data be found?
Variable data resides in directories like /home and /var/mail.
Which column of /etc/fstab lists mount options?
4th column
Special form of tr argument ([:argument:]), that represents all punctuation characters?
[:punct:]
Name and location of the dpkg configuration file?
/etc/dpkg/dpkg.cfg
Option to have mkdir create parent directories as needed?

$ mkdir -p

or

$ mkdir --parents

e.g.: 
$ mkdir -p newdir/new/1
File in which file system mounting options for disk quotas can be specified in?
/etc/fstab
Where is standard error written to by default?
Stderr defaults to the terminal.
What does the number 1 stand for, in the 6th column of /etc/fstab?
Will be checked preferably by fsck.
Command to create a new user or update default new user information?
$ useradd
Metacharacter(s) to match anything except enclosed characters in sed, grep and vi?

circumflex/caret (^) as the first character in square brackets ([^ ])

e.g.:
To not match all lower- and uppercase letters:
[^a-Z]
Command to adjust tuneable filesystem parameters on ext2/ext3/ext4 filesystems?
$ tune2fs
Command to sort lines of text files?
$ sort
In the Master Boot Record (MBR) partition table, one partition entry equals one...

row. 

(Each row in the partition table equals one partition entry.)
Name and location of the apt-cache cache?
/var/cache/apt/archives
What does the Filesystem Hierarchy Standard (FHS) consist of?
This standard consists of a set of requirements and guidelines for file and directory placement under UNIX-like operating systems.
Command to create a compressed archive (archive.tar.bz2) of /etc/ and verbosely list files processed?
$ tar -cvjf archive.tar.bz2 /etc/*
~/.profile is read on new log ins, if which 2 files are not present?

~/.bash_profile
~/.bash_login
The /dev filesystem contains files that ...
allow programs to access devices.
HAL has been merged into wich program?
HAL is now deprecated as it is being merged into udev.
Command to cause normal process termination with the exit status code 1?
$ exit 1
What is the short form of 'rpm --nodeps'?
There is none.
Command to print a sequence of numbers?
$ seq
ksh combines ...?

- the script language features of bash with 
- all features of C Shell (csh) and Tab C shell (tcsh)
Character to begin a commented line with?

#

e.g.:
# This line is a comment.h
By which two \characters can new lines be referred to?

Carriage Return = \r
Line Feed = \n
How does the SCSI naming system look like for tapes?
/dev/st0, /dev/st1, ...etc
Filesystem independent mount option (for use with mount or in /etc/fstab) to forbid an ordinary (i.e., non-root) user to mount the filesystem?
nouser
Option to use with mysql to connect the server on a given host name?

$ mysql -h <HOSTNAME>

or

$ mysql --host=<HOSTNAME>
Location of the yum cache file?
/var/cache/yum/
What is the path for the GRUB legacy configuration files? [3]

/boot/grub/device.map
/boot/grub/grub.conf 
/boot/grub/menu.lst -> softlink to /boot/grub/grub.conf
Interactive option to have top print a defined number of lines of output?

n

e.g.: 
n 10 for a list of just 10 processes.
Which standard wildcard can represent a range of characters?
[ ] (square brackets)
Command to create a backup copy of file.txt with cp?
$ cp file.txt file.bak
Command to find out in which runlevel the system currently is?
$ runlevel
The backup tool dump creates databackups from whole...?
partitions
Which octal number represents write permissions?

2

e.g.:
write (w) = 010 = 2
According to the Filesystem Hierarchy Standard (FHS) which directory contains the second major section of the filesystem?
/usr
File system mounting option to enable group quota support on a file system?
grpquota
Command to set or unset values of shell options and positional parameters?
$ set
What is SQL used for?
SQL (Structured Query Language) is a standardized programming language used for managing relational databases and access and manipulate the data in them.
When using mount to mount a filesystem, what is the default? Read-only or read/write?
read/write
grub-mkconfig uses which two files as templates?

- /etc/default/grub
- /etc/grub.d
What do symbolic links refer to?
Symbolic links refer to a symbolic path indicating the abstract location of another file.
Option to use with chmod to change files and directories recursively?

$ chmod -R

or

$ chmod --recursive
systemd: Command to change the runlevel to single user mode?
$ systemctl isolate rescue.target
Control character (escaped) which represents the form feed?
\f
Option to have wc only print the amount of lines?
$ wc -l
MySQL command to get basic help from the server?

mysql> \h;

or

mysql> help;
MySQL command to print the 'first_name' column of the table 'phone_numbers' in 'contacts' database?

mysql> USE contacts;

mysql> SELECT first_name FROM phone_numbers;
Option(s) to use with test to check if one integer is equal to another integer?

$ test -eq

e.g.:
function function-name()
{
while test $# -eq 0
do
    ...
done
}
Option to use with find to search for files which were last accessed n minutes ago?

$ find -amin n

e.g.: 
$ find -amin 5
./.mozilla/firefox/vrunnjyt.default/datareporting/aborted-session-ping
What are I/O ports?
Unique locations in memory, reserved for communications between CPU and specific physical hardware devices.
Option to use with fsck to use an alternative superblock?

$ fsck <FILESYSTEM> -b BLOCK

Explanation:
This option is normally used when the primary superblock has been corrupted. The -b option is not understood by fsck, it will be passed to the filesystem-specific checker.
Option to use with modinfo to show the file name of a module?

$ modinfo -n

or 

$ modinfo --filename
Command to convert tabs in tabs.txt to 6 spaces and write the output to spaces.txt?
$ expand -t 6 tabs.txt > spaces.txt
What is the difference between I/O addresses and I/O ports?
There is no difference. They are just two different names for the same thing.
Command to report a snapshot of current processes?
$ ps
Location where one can find kernel messages?
/var/log/messages
What is the rule of thumb for swap space size?
Swap size should be twice the size of the physical RAM.
Command to load all networking modules at the same time?

$ modprobe -at net

or 

$ modprobe --all --type net
What is an alternative name for a soft link?

- symbolic link
- symlink
According to the Filesystem Hierarchy Standard (FHS) which directory contains data for services provided by the system?

/srv

e.g.: 
www-root, ftp-root
Command to locate the binary, source, and manual page files for a command?
$ whereis
How do firmware, boot loader and OS are connected?

- The firmware reads the boot loader into memory from the hard disk and executes it.
- The boot loader loads the Linux kernel into the memory and starts it running.
What is a Microkernel?
An OS architecture where the core functionality is isolated from system services and device drivers.
Option to have du write counts for all files, not just directories?
$ du -a
Command to update the /partition/aquota.user file with quotacheck?
$ quotacheck -vu /partition
Command to use chgrp to recursively change the group ownership of files in /files to usergroup?
$ chgrp -R usergroup /files
What could cause rpm to not install a package? [2]

- missing dependencies
- conflict(s) with another package
Which system wide configuration file is read by the login shell?
/etc/profile
What is the difference between /etc/fstab and /etc/mtab?

- /etc/fstab lists filesystems to be mounted at boot time.
- /etc/mtab lists currently mounted filesystems.
What is (U)EFI?
(U)EFI is firmware, installed on the motherboot, which controls the boot process.
What is the default size (in lines) split splits files into?
1000 lines
How to boot a system with GRUB legacy after entering root, kernel and initrd information?
grub> boot
Option to use with test to check if the length of <STRING> is zero?
$ test -z <STRING>
Command to dump ext2/ext3/ext4 filesystem information?
$ dumpe2fs
Option to have sort sort lines by numeric values?
$ sort -n
Which file does bash look for, if ~/.bash_login and ~/.bash_profile do not exist?
~/.profile
Option(s) to use with test to check if one integer is less than another integer?

$ test -lt

e.g.:
function function-name()
{
while test $# -lt 1
do
    ...
done
}
Which command searches the NAME and DESCRIPTION fields of all man pages?
$ apropos
Options to use with dpkg to display information about a package? [2]

$ dpkg -s <package.deb>

or

$ dpkg --status <package.deb>
Escape sequence (backslash-escaped special character) for suppressing further output ('End of Text' control character)?

\c

e.g.:
$ echo -e "Hello World\c"

Explanation:
Suppresses a possible trailing newline.
Command to print only comments contained in /etc/crontab and also remove empty lines?
$ grep -v ^[#] /etc/crontab | grep -v ^$
What is SIGTSTP?

The Terminal stop signal (to suspend a job).

e.g.: 
$ kill -20

or

ctrl+z
systemd: Name of the tool to manage services?
systemctl
What is special about tar in regard to options?

Options for tar do not need to be prefixed with -.
They still may be combined with other single-letter options.

Long function names must be prefixed with a double dash --.
Which 2 files are read by login shells after logging in?

1. /etc/profile
2. ~/.bash_profile
Example commands for Data Manipulation Language (DML)? [5]

- COMMIT
- INSERT
- ROLLBACK
- SELECT
- UPDATE
Command to use chown to set the user ownership of /files/user1 recursively to root?
$ chmod root /files/user1 -R
Option to use with find to search for files which were last accessed n*24 hours ago?
$ find -atime n
How to enable / disable hardware before and once Linux is booted?

1. The firmaware's interface (before Linux is booted)
2. Linux utilities (once it's booted; modprobe, insmod, rmmod)
What does lspci do?
lspci displays information about PCI buses and devices connected to them.
Escape sequence (backslash-escaped special character) for carriage return?
\r
tune2fs option to adjust the number of mounts after which the filesystem will be checked by fsck?

$ tune2fs -c 

e.g.: 
$ tune2fs -c 5
Which tar option is an exception to the rule that the order of options does not matter?

For the -f or --file option, as it needs another argument.

e.g.: 
$ tar -cvf archive.tar /Downloads/*
Command to print all signals which can be sent to running processes with kill?
$ kill -l
How to connect/disconnect hotplug devices?
Hotplug devices are designed to be connected/disconnected anytime (be the computer on or off).
Command to remove the variable 'foo' from the current shell?
$ unset foo
Name 5 task-related information which are displayed by top.

- number of total processes
- number running processes
- number of sleeping processes
- number of stopped processes
- number of zombie processes
According to the Filesystem Hierarchy Standard (FHS) which directory contains essential shared libraries and kernel modules?
/lib
Command to print the last 10 lines of Syslog?
$ tail /var/log/messages
Which is the name and location of the user readline init file?
~/.inputrc
Command to count newlines, words and bytes?
$ wc
Command to set an alias 'space' to run free and df?
$ alias space='free; df'
Option to use with find to search for file name patterns?

$ find -name

e.g.:
$ find Music/ -name '*.ogg'
Which is the default signal sent by kill?

SIGTERM (15)

e.g.: 
$ kill firefox = $ kill -15 firefox
Command to delete a custom variable (x) in bash?
$ unset x
MySQL command to use to specify the layout of a table?

mysql> CREATE TABLE;

e.g.:
What is RAM used for?
RAM (memory hardware) holds data for CPU computations.
MySQL command to print the 'first_name' and 'last_name' column of the table 'phone_numbers' in 'contacts' database?

mysql> USE contacts;

mysql> SELECT first_name,last_name FROM phone_numbers;

e.g.:
What does the command '$ tune2fs -i 0d' do?
The value of zero disables the time-dependent filesystem checks with fsck.
systemd: Command to start service "example1" on bootup?
$ systemctl enable example1
Character to append to a command to run it in the background?

& 

e.g.:
$ <program> &
Names of system wide (global) configuration filesconfiguration files, which are valid for all users, never begin with which character?

.

e.g.:
/etc/bash.bashrc
Command to run a command immune to hangups, with output to a non-tty?
$ nohup
Command line to echo 'Lorem Ipsum' with a preceding new line?

$ echo -e "\nLorem Ipsum"

e.g.:
Commands to enable/disable devices and files for paging and swapping? [2]

1. $ swapon
2. $ swapoff
Which is the default MySQL declaration delimiter for commands?
What is the output of the command 'echo 'The status code was \"$?\"''
The status code was \"$?\"
Commands to print all environment variables? [2]

$ env  

or

$ printenv

e.g.: 
$ env | less
$ printenv | less
Command to set SUID on file.txt the symbolic way?
$ chmod u+s file.txt
What is the difference between the BIOS & (U)EFI boot process?

The BIOS boot process begins by reading a boot sector from a disk, and executing that code. Boot options are limited (e.g. boot device order).

The UEFI boot process begins by reading a boot loader file from the so called EFI System Partition. The UEFI boot process offers and extended range of boot options. Many EFI implementations support BIOS compatibility.
After modifying a partition table with fdisk, what is the actual command to build a ext2, ext3 or ext4 filesystem only?
$ mke2fs
Command to set text-width of input.txt to 60 columns and save the result to output.txt?
$ fmt -w 60 input.txt > output.txt
Command line to echo how many time $b is contained in $a as $c (devide $a by $b)?

$ echo $a / $b = $c

e.g.:
Wildcard metacharacter to match any number (or none) of the single character that immediately precedes it in sed, grep and vi?
asterisk (*)
What are 2 common options for rmmod?

-v (verbose)
-f (force)
Option to have free print the amount of memory in gigabytes?

$ free -g

or

$ free --giga
What is /proc/ also called?

What is the difference between LVM and traditional disk management?

Traditional disk management:
The operating system looks for what disks are available (/dev/sda, /dev/sdb, etc.) and then looks at what partitions are available on those disks (/dev/sda1, /dev/sda2, etc.).

Logical Volume Management:
Disks and partitions can be abstracted to contain multiple disks and partitions into one device. LVM will only show the OS the volume groups (disks) and logical volumes (partitions) that you have set up.
